Take a panoramic tour of Bombay

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
You’ll discover the neighborhood of Colaba with the emblem of the city: The Gateway of India and the Taj Mahal Palace, the monumental Victorian station, the university, the clock tower, and more. We’ll then visit the museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi, the “Father of the nation”, who led India to independence. It hosts a rich collection of objects that belonged to Gandhi. Photo op at the traditional “open air laundromat”.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
You’ll discover the neighborhood of Colaba with the emblem of the city: The Gateway of India and the Taj Mahal Palace, the monumental Victorian station, the university, the clock tower, and more. We’ll then visit the museum dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi, the “Father of the nation”, who led India to independence. It hosts a rich collection of objects that belonged to Gandhi. Photo op at the traditional “open air laundromat”.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Elephanta island is famous because it is home to the “city of caves”, a collection of archaeological cave temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva.  This first class rupestrian site was added to UNESCO’s list in 1987 and bears witness to its rich past. We’ll gain access to the sight on small boats. The caves are divided into two groups: Five Hindu caves and two Buddhist caves that were carved directly into the mountain. Its masterpiece is the monumental seven-meter sculpture representing Shiva in three forms: the creator, the protector, and the destroyer.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
The recently opened Louvre Abu Dhabi museum is an architectural landmark in itself. Built on an island between the sea and the sand, the museum’s dimensions are colossal and include 260,000 square feet of exhibits (24,000 m2). It was conceived to be a place where dialog between civilizations, cultures, and religions can be cultivated and promoted. It is the top universal museum in the Arab world and was conceived and designed by French architect Jean Nouvel. After our tour, we'll return to the port by way of the Al Bateen district.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Abu Dhabi: The Presidential Palace and the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Abu Dhabi: The Presidential Palace and the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a visit to the Presidential Palace (Qasr Al Watan, or “Palace of the Nation”), which recently opened its doors to the public at the initiative of the Emir of Abu Dhabi, thus allowing visitors to discover the traditions and values of his country. The palace houses a library containing 50,000 works and exhibit rooms where the many gifts offered to the country are put on display. We’ll also stroll through the gardens of this majestic palace. Next, we’ll visit the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque (named after the immensely revered “Father of the Nation”), a veritable work of art with its 10,000 columns, chandeliers plated in 24-karat gold, and the capacity to hold 40,000 people.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Dubai: The Burj Khalifa Tower and Palm Island

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Dubai: The Burj Khalifa Tower and Palm Island

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll embark on an excursion that is ahead of its time, where the limitless creative spirit and imagination of humankind raised the highest tower in the world out of the sand and sea on stunning Palm Island. This island is built to resemble the outline of a palm tree. It was created from scratch and is home to many splendid villas and sumptuous hotel complexes. Next, well ascend to the top of the Burj Khalifa, the highest human-made structure ever built (2,716.5 feet/828 meters). You’ll enjoy a breathtaking, panoramic view of the Persian Gulf from its observation deck.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Here, you can let your wildest dreams take flight while walking in the footsteps of the past. We’ll visit the city’s oldest building: the Al Fahidi Fort, built in 1787 and later converted into a museum. You’ll discover the traditional, urban, and rural lifestyles in the Emirate of Dubai. It is a veritable kaleidoscope, giving you a glimpse of the many facets of the country over the past centuries. Next, we’ll stroll through traditional markets, or “souks,” selling everything from aromatic spices to gold. The lively atmosphere of the souk is the perfect setting to discover and interact with the local population.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a visit to Khasab Fort, built by the Portuguese in the 17th century to protect their trading activities in the highly-coveted area. We’ll continue our discovery as we navigate along the coastal route to Bukha. We’ll stop in the small, traditional village of Mukhi, known for its old, cubic houses clinging to the steep mountain. This craggy region offers visitors spectacular views of the landscape.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Climb aboard a dhow, the ancestral sailing vessel of this region, used in centuries past to transport merchandise, passengers, and even slaves. Today, these elegant wooden ships with triangular sails navigate the fjords of the Musandam Peninsula. On turquoise waters, the dhow sails in search of the most beautiful landscapes and the steepest, most stunning cliffs. You can enjoy a swim in one of the inlets where the waters are calm and refreshing.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll take the coastal route, winding under the watchful eye of the Al Jalali, Al Mirani, and Muttrah forts. We’ll stop for a photo op at the very camera-friendly Al Alam Palace, ceremonial residence of Sultan Qaboos of Oman. We’ll continue our city tour with a visit to the Royal Opera House Muscat, inaugurated in 2011 and able to seat 1,100 spectators, and the new, colossal parliament building. Enjoy some time on your own by discovering the souk of Muttrah. In this maze of narrow streets and alleyways stretching along the Corniche, the stalls offer a variety of goods: spices, souvenirs, trinkets, gold jewelry, and much more.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Nizwa, along the route of Oman¿s fortresses

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Nizwa, along the route of Oman’s fortresses

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Well before Muscat, Nizwa was the country’s capital city. Located in the heart of a mountainous region, at the crossroads of old caravan routes, Nizwa is a veritable oasis. You’ll enjoy sumptuous panoramic views from the wall-walk of its magnificent fortress. The nearby souk will give you an opportunity to purchase a few souvenirs. Enjoy lunch on board. We’ll cross a region with high mountains and terrace cultivation (the Jebel Akhdar). Enjoy a leisurely stroll through the village of Al Hamra, where the past is still alive. The small houses made of mud, pebbles, and palm beams have an irresistible charm and are in the process of being restored. You’ll visit a typical home and meet with the local population for coffee and a bite of a few dates.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Sur: From a desert to the wadi

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Sur: From a desert to the wadi

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Our four-wheel-drive vehicles will take you on an exciting excursion to discover a rare curiosity: the wadis—vast, natural stretches of water shaded by palm, date, and mango trees. Enjoy a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear, fresh water of the Wadi Bani Khaled. It’s like heaven on earth. We’ll head to the Wahiba Sands desert. The contrast is striking. The route becomes straight and linear, a few dromedaries wander onto the asphalt, and the sand whirlwinds with the passage of each car. Soon, we’ll arrive on the stretches of golden sand. We’ll enjoy lunch in one of the desert camps. The expedition continues on the sand tracks, at the foot of the rippling dunes—some of which measure as high as three hundred feet. At the end of the day, the spectacle is breathtaking when the crests of the dunes shimmer with iridescence in the sunlight.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
Our four-wheel-drive vehicles will take you on an exciting excursion to discover a rare curiosity: the wadis—vast, natural stretches of water shaded by palm, date, and mango trees. Enjoy a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear, fresh water of the Wadi Bani Khaled. It’s like heaven on earth. We’ll head to the Wahiba Sands desert. The contrast is striking. The route becomes straight and linear, a few dromedaries wander onto the asphalt, and the sand whirlwinds with the passage of each car. Soon, we’ll arrive on the stretches of golden sand. We’ll enjoy lunch in one of the desert camps. The expedition continues on the sand tracks, at the foot of the rippling dunes—some of which measure as high as three hundred feet. At the end of the day, the spectacle is breathtaking when the crests of the dunes shimmer with iridescence in the sunlight.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Early in the morning, things are already bustling at the Muttrah Fish Market. Chiseled-faced fishermen negotiate the price for their daily catch. After, we’ll visit the Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque. Inaugurated in 2001, it can welcome up to 20,000 worshipers. A veritable work of art in itself, the mosque radiates throughout the entire city. The jewel in its crown is a monumental Persian prayer carpet measuring about 45,000 square feet (4,263 m2). This handmade masterpiece took four years to complete and weighs 21 tons. Join us for a visit to the Bait Al Zubair private museum, housed in a stately white residence built in the typical Omani architectural style. This ethnographic museum is home to one of the most beautiful collections demonstrating the lifestyle of the family of Sheikh Al Zubair: sabers, firearms, traditional women’s costumes, jewels, musical instruments, objects used in daily life, and more.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Climb aboard a dhow—a traditional sailing vessel and the pride of Omani mariners. Made of wood, the dhow was used to travel from region to region and from country to country. Today, dhows are a visitor’s delight, allowing them to admire the rocky coastline and long sandy beaches against the backdrop of the high mountains.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Full-day excursion to the Wadi Rum desert

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Full-day excursion to the Wadi Rum desert

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion in the Wadi Rum desert (lunch included). Alongside Petra, it is one of Jordan’s must-see sites. We’ll stop for many photo ops as we make our way by Jeep, allowing you to discover the desert made famous by Lawrence of Arabia. You’ll be dazzled by the spectacular colors of the desert, seeing them change according to the radiance of the sunlight as the day progresses. The Bedouins that inhabit the Wadi Rum are well known for their hospitality: Under their tent, you’ll be invited to enjoy tea and luscious goodies, specialties of their local cuisine.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a full-day excursion to Jerusalem (lunch included; approx. 10 hours total, incl. 4 hours round trip). Jerusalem is one of the holiest and most fascinating cities in the world. The old city is home to over 200 historical monuments, including the Wailing Wall and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre. During this tour, we will discover the Mount of Olives, the Garden of Gethsemane, Mount Zion, as well as the colorful market where the three main religions—Christianity, Judaism, and Islam—live side by side.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Famous for its luscious landscapes dotted with rolling hills and valleys, its small picturesque cities and its historic sites, Galilee is the best kept secret in Israel.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
Famous for its luscious landscapes dotted with rolling hills and valleys, its small picturesque cities and its historic sites, Galilee is the best kept secret in Israel.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We'll set off on a visit to Acre (Saint John of Acre), headquarters of the Knights Hospitaller during Crusades in the Holy Land. The old city of Acre, a UNESCO world heritage site, is home to many remarkable sites, such as ruins from the Greco-Roman period as well as from the time of the Crusades and the Ottoman Empire. Its fascinating historical heritage where East meets West and the unique ruins of the different cultures make it one of the most important cities of the ancient world.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Discover one of the most spectacular sites in Greece. Although the original town of Kalambaka was destroyed during World War II, the Meteora monasteries remained intact on the summit of the rocks. The caves in the rocks were inhabited by hermit monks in the 9th century AD. They began to build monasteries in the 11th century, and at its peak in the 16th century, there were 24. Today, there are now six functioning monasteries still inhabited by either nuns or monks.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Guided tour of La Sagrada Familia

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Antoni Gaudi’s magnum opus, La Sagrada Familia. Five generations have watched the cathedral being built, and it is still a work in progress. The work of art contains never-before-seen building and structural systems suffused with symbolism and the utmost care in every detail. We’ll continue our celebration of Gaudi at the Park Güell, perched on the hills of the city. The park is designed to bring the peace and calm expected from nature, contrasted with the fantastically shaped roofs and unusual pinnacles dotting the buildings.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Mallorca, the largest of the Balearic Islands, is no stranger to tourists. Join us for a tour of the heart of the island and its charming villages surrounded by farmland and olive and almond groves. We’ll take in the beauty of the Serra de Tramuntana, a mountain range that has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site that forms a backbone on the island along the northwestern coast. We’ll visit Valldemossa, a village steeped in old-world charm, tucked in the middle of the mountains, and surrounded by lush forests. Our tour includes the Valldemossa Charterhouse, where George Sand and Frederic Chopin wrote and composed, respectively, some of their greatest work. We’ll then visit the island’s vibrant and stylish capital, Palma, traveling through the lovely small streets of its historic district to pay a visit to the imposing 14th-century cathedral known as La Seu.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
The Route of the Borgias traces the history of one of the most prominent families in Spain. Join us for a unique way to visit the province by discovering the art and heritage associated with the legacy of the Borgias Dynasty, which includes two popes. They were one of the most powerful families during the Renaissance, with members holding important positions in the government. This tour includes stops in the village of Xativa and the Ducal Palace in Gandia.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Murcia is a treasure trove of cultures and history, most notable for its Baroque splendors. We’ll first stroll through the old town to reach Cardenal Belluga Square, where most of the city’s main sites are located. Take a tour of the cathedral, a combination of three prominent styles of architecture spanning five centuries and whose tower is the symbol of Murcia.

  • Times are approximate.

Guided tour of Malaga and the Picasso Museum

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Guided tour of Malaga and the Picasso Museum

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Located along the Costa del Sol, under the watchful eye of the Castillo de Gibralfaro, sits the vibrant city of Malaga. Malaga is much more than a seaside resort as it is home to some fantastic museums, including one dedicated to its native son, Pablo Picasso. We’ll take a stroll through the historic center to see some of the main sites, including the Alcazaba fortress and the Roman theater. After, we’ll visit the cathedral before heading to the Picasso Museum, devoted to the influential, 20th-century artist.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll leave by coach to begin our panoramic tour of Cádiz, one of the oldest cities in Europe, to take in the culturally rich city center and the gorgeous views of the harbor. The old quarter of the city is famous for its narrow streets, sunny plazas, museums, art gallerias, and cafés. We’ll stop off for a visit to the cathedral, which took nearly a century to build, combines several styles, and contains a crypt built with oyster stone.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
This excursion brings you to two of the most charming towns in the region, Lagos and Silves. Silves stands out mostly for its Moorish heritage, which made it a major defensive stronghold and trading center for over three centuries. This city has a much slower pace than the coastal resorts and is a great place to get a feel for daily life in Portugal. After, we’ll visit Lagos, known for its walled town and gorgeous cliffs overlooking the Atlantic beaches. We’ll stop for a photo op at the Ponta da Piedade rock formations, one of the finest natural features along the coastline.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Discover the distinctive buildings and landmarks in the Belém District, where we’ll stop to visit the church at the Jerónimos Monastery—an impressive example of Portugal’s wealth and power during the Age of Discovery. You’ll then have the time to relax with a cup of coffee and fresh pastry at the local bakery. Our next stop will be Belém Tower, which sits isolated in the port waters as the ceremonial gateway to Lisbon. You’ll also see the Monument of the Discoveries, an homage to the glorious past of the country’s exploration across the seas. We’ll wrap up the excursion with a panoramic tour of the city’s other major sites, such as the Rossio, Marquis of Pombal Square, Avenida da Liberdade, and Eduardo VII Park.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll cross through the heart of Lisbon and follow the ancient walls into the Mouraria and Alfama Districts. Although the Great Lisbon Earthquake of 1755 wiped out most of the city, these two districts were least hit and are now the oldest and hippest areas of the city. Mouraria is thought to be the birthplace of Fado music. Alfama is the heart and soul of the city. Our local guides will give us their perceptive, personalized points of view of the city they love. Jump back in time and get to know Lisbon’s past on a stroll with us along the city’s narrow streets.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Full Day on the East Coast of Madeira

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Full Day on the East Coast of Madeira

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll head to the east of the island to Ponta do Garajau and the Art Deco statue of Christ the King that overlooks the sea. This excursion will bring you to the gorgeous scenery and stunning vistas Madeira is famous for. From here, we’ll head to the picturesque village of Camacha, known worldwide for its wicker baskets and colorful folklore. We’ll stop at an exhibit showcasing a few examples of typical baskets. We’ll then continue on the sinuous roads through Ribeiro Frio to the village of Santana, known for its unique, triangular homes and thatched roofs. The next stop will be the Portela viewpoint to take in the mountainous landscape falling directly into the ocean. Our tour includes a trip through the beautiful agricultural landscape in the fertile valley around Machico. We’ll have lunch during our excursion.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for a guided tour of Funchal’s old town and its top sites. The old town is a picturesque setting of narrow cobblestone streets lined by buildings dating back to the 15th century. A must-see in the city is the groundbreaking street-art program “Arte de Portas Abertas,” which has brought to life over 200 doors on Rua Santa Maria. We’ll then continue on to the local market, jam packed with tropical fruit, gorgeous vegetables, fragrant flowers, and local crafts. This is a great way to take part in the daily rhythm of life on the island. We’ll also visit Blandy's Wine Lodge, an opportunity to experience local winemaking. Purchased by John Blandy in the mid-19th century, each of the rooms has a different temperature and humidity, which gives each wine a different character based on its location. Of course, we’ll finish up our visit with a tasting.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
The Madeira Botanical Gardens is one of the most beautiful gardens in the region and also provides marvelous views overlooking the city of Funchal below. The gardens were created by the Reid family as a private park in the 1880s. Today, it is a well-maintained public park with a wide variety of endemic plants. After admiring the gardens, we’ll jump on the cable car to Monte Parish. Monte oozes timeless romanticism, and the views are second to none. Here, you’ll also learn about the “basket cars,” a solution to carry the wealthy from Monte to Funchal back in the 19th century that is now an iconic tourist attraction.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
The Madeira Botanical Gardens is one of the most beautiful gardens in the region and also provides marvelous views overlooking the city of Funchal below. After admiring the gardens, we’ll jump on the cable car to Monte Parish. Monte oozes timeless romanticism, and the views are second to none. Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
This excursion takes us along the southern part of the island to Furnas Valley. Our first stop will be the Terra Nostra Botanical Park, one of the best-kept secrets in the world. In the 1770s, a wealthy merchant from Boston named Thomas Hickling built a simple wooden summer house here, which came to be known as Yankee Hall. The valley became a popular spa town at the end of the 18th century due to the interest in using mineral water to cure health problems. The garden is located in the middle of this magnificent water system. In fact, the valley is actually a crater of a long-extinct volcano that has hundreds of small springs and streams and its own particular climate. We'll leave the Furnas Valley behind for the northern section of the island to tour a local tea plantation. We'll visit the factory and enjoy a nice cup of tea while we're at it (subject to availability).

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll head to Criação Velha, centrally located in the high-quality winemaking area. After a short stroll in the area, we'll continue along the coastline, passing through São Mateus and the “mysterios” in São João and Silveira, land formed by volcanic activity. We’ll stop at the museum that recounts the island’s whaling history with and contains many of the original tools. Once a major source of income for the islanders, it was banned in the 1980s. The Azores is now one of the most predominant areas to visit for whale-watching vacations. Lastly, we’ll cross the island to Porto do Cachorro, known for its rugged, black lava stone coastline and vineyards.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Text:

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Our first stop will be the overlook at Espalamaca, where you’ll get a great view of the charming Horta, its port, and the neighboring islands. We’ll then head to the highest point in the islands, the Caldeira, traveling through Flamingo Valley. The road climbs over 3,000 feet (925 m) to the top of the volcanic cone in the middle of the island. The views into and around the 1.2-mile (2 km), 1,300-foot (400 m) perimeter of the cone are spectacular. After, we'll travel to Capelinhos, to admire the moonscape scenery of the site of a volcanic eruption in the 1950s that lasted about a year.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Lecce is, quite simply, a Baroque masterpiece. So much so that it has its own name: barocco leccese. Nicknamed “The Florence of the South,” the city is overflowing with rich, historical monuments. At each corner, you’ll find a palace or church built from the soft, workable limestone that is easy to sculpt. Among the many architectural splendors we’ll see from the outside are the buildings in the Piazza del Duomo—including the Duomo, Bishop’s Palace, and Seminary Palace—the Roman amphitheater excavated after World War II, and the Basilica di Santa Croce.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Naples and a Bite of Pizza

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Naples was settled by the Greeks and is now the third-largest metropolitan area in Italy. Its historic city center is the largest in Europe and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. What better way to absorb the beauty, color, sounds, and flavor of Naples than an excursion to its top attractions? After a short panoramic tour up to the coastal section of Mergellina, we’ll begin with a walk to see the outside of some iconic monuments: the large public square Piazza del Plebiscito, the church of San Francesco di Paola, Royal Palace, Galleria Umberto I shopping area, and San Carlo Opera House. After our tour, we’ll stop in a pizzeria to learn how true Neapolitan pizza is made, and of course, we’ll enjoy a bite.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
Naples was settled by the Greeks and is now the third-largest metropolitan area in Italy. Its historic city center is the largest in Europe and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. What better way to absorb the beauty, color, sounds, and flavor of Naples than an excursion to its top attractions? After a short panoramic tour up to the coastal section of Mergellina, we’ll begin with a walk to see the outside of some iconic monuments: the large public square Piazza del Plebiscito, the church of San Francesco di Paola, Royal Palace, Galleria Umberto I shopping area, and San Carlo Opera House. After our tour, we’ll stop in a pizzeria to learn how true Neapolitan pizza is made, and of course, we’ll enjoy a bite.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Join us for an excursion along Sardinia’s Costa Smeralda—the Emerald Coast—to take in the beaches lapped by crystal-clear waters and the scenery dotted with cliffs, bays, and coves. We’ll also stop at a local wine cellar for a tasting. We’ll arrive in the charming port-town of Palau in the late morning. Our first stop will be Maddalena Island in the Maddalena Archipelago, a seven-island national park that has been sculpted by the wind and waves. The archipelago was declared the first national park in Sardinia in 1994 and has been on a tentative list for consideration as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2006. We’ll have lunch during our excursion.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Full-day excursion to Masada and the Dead Sea

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Full-day excursion to Masada and the Dead Sea

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Full-day excursion including Masada and the Dead Sea (lunch included; approx. 12 hours total, incl. 5 hours round trip). Masada is one of Israel’s most popular tourist destinations. The breathtaking, strategic location is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of heroism and importance within Jewish culture. Masada was built in 30 BC by King Herod. When Israel began its great revolt against Rome in 68 AD, the site became a stronghold for Jewish rebels. The Romans besieged Masada in the year 72. Rather than be taken alive by their adversaries, the population of Masada chose to die by suicide. After our stirring visit to this important historical site, we will continue to the Dead Sea for lunch and an afternoon at the side of the pool or in the sea’s beneficial waters and muds.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
You’ll depart on a mini-bus for the center of Dubrovnik, where you’ll board a local ferry that will take you to the small island facing the city’s old town. Lokrum is a calm, leafy haven providing a refreshing break from the crowds of the city. Countless pine, cypress, and olive trees provide ample shade. The island is also home to a botanical garden and the ruins of a Benedictine monastery. Several beaches give access to swimming in the crystal-clear Adriatic Sea. As with most beaches in Croatia, the beaches on the island are bordered with pebbles and stones, not sand. At the end of the excursion, you’ll return to our ship by ferry and mini-bus.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
We’ll leave by coach for the falconry center, founded in 2000 to educate the public about wildlife conservation and to protect birds of prey. This experience will bring you face to face with otherwise elusive feathered creatures. A special presentation gives a good glimpse into how falcons are trained, how they fly and hunt, and how they interact with humans. After our excursion, we’ll return to the ship.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
You’ll leave on foot for the point of departure on board a rare underwater vessel. It’s just like scuba diving, without getting wet! In the underwater observatory, you can watch the thriving marine life. The upper deck remains above the waterline, so you can take in the outside scenery at any time as well. Don’t miss this great opportunity to observe the sea and its hidden wonders. You’ll return to the ship on foot.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Grande-Terre, one of Guadeloupe’s “butterfly wings,” has white beaches to the south, sheer cliffs to the north, and lush green plains in between.  We’ll stop for photo ops at the Zevallos Colonial Estate, one of the last colonial-style homes on the island, and the spectacular the rocky peninsula of Pointe des Châteaux with magnificent views of the sea and surrounding islands.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Basse-Terre Island, Guadeloupe’s other “butterfly wing,” is covered with dense, tropical vegetation.  We’ll visit the Valombreuse Floral Park, a vast botanical garden filled with tropical plants and flowers. We’ll then walk along a lushly lined path that follows the Corossol River to an idyllic jungle waterfall, the Cascade aux Ecrevisses.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Sulphur Springs Park and a Cocoa Plantation

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Sulphur Springs Park and a Cocoa Plantation

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
This excursion will bring you to the Qualibou Volcano and the wonders found in this geothermal area. Although the last time the volcano erupted was over 200 years ago, its activity is evident in the pools of boiling mud and water. People come here from all over the world just take a dip in the mud baths! After, we’ll take a tour of the Morne Coubaril Historical Adventure Park  to learn the history of the plantation’s cocoa and coffee bean production.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Tet Paul Nature Trail and Diamond Falls Botanical Garden

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Tet Paul Nature Trail and Diamond Falls Botanical Garden

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Diamond Falls Botanical Garden—located on the southern side of Saint Lucia—is home to a stunning variety of tropical flowers, plant life, birds, and insects. Enjoy a stroll through a sample of the breathtaking beauty found on the island. The highlight of this excursion is the waters of the falls. They are laced with minerals, which give the rocks and water a colorful appearance. After, we’ll hike along the Tet Paul Nature Trail to a splendid overlook across the southern part of the island.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Full Day in the Tobago Cays

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a calm and peaceful haven of islands where you can get away from it all. This day excursion on a catamaran will give you memories to last a lifetime. The Tobago Cays are a group of five inhabited islands surrounded by a coral reef. The entire area is a protected marine park that contains a wide variety of native sea life. You’ll enjoy a delicious lobster bake lunch on one of the islands and then have a swim on Morpion Island.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Our tour of Martinique encompasses the island’s deep history, including one of its most somber: The enslavement of Africans. We’ll visit the Savane des Esclaves—an open-air museum hand-built by a descendant of enslaved people—to learn about the struggles, culture, and art during this dark time. The tour guide presents the difficult conditions of life, the agricultural techniques during the time, and the production and transformation of many food products that make the French Antilles so famous:  sugar cane, cacao, and coffee. We’ll then continue on to the Clément Estate, a national historical monument. The estate is a great example of a tropical homestead and plantation in the Caribbean. We'll visit the famous rum distillery and enjoy a tasting.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
You’ll spend an hour on a condensed tour of the island from the seat of a local taxi. Your driver will bring you to the top sites, including charming Gustavia, the most beautiful beaches on the island, legendary ballet dancer Rudolf Nureyev’s former home, and Lorient, with its blossoming graveyards.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
This panoramic tour will let you discover the tiny corners of paradise on the island—where Mother Nature rules alongside humankind’s traditions. Marie-Galante is known as the Island of 1,000 Windmills. These mills and the bounty of sugar cane fields seem endless. One aspect of our tour will focus on the Murat Plantation, one of the largest in Guadeloupe during the 19th century but now the home to the Museum of Arts and Popular Traditions.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Learn About the History and Culture Found on the Island

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Learn About the History and Culture Found on the Island

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
This excursion of the former British colony begins with a tour of the imposing Brimstone Hill Fortress National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Although the country is a bit off the regular tourist path, it is famous for preserving its important heritage—especially its batik fabric decoration techniques.  You’ll visit a workshop to learn about this art before returning to Basse-Terre, the capital city of Guadeloupe.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Lively Saint Kitts is known for its amazing beaches. You’ll be able to relax in your little corner of paradise under an umbrella, lying on a chaise lounge, with a drink in hand.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:
Lively Saint Kitts is known for its amazing beaches. You’ll be able to relax in your little corner of paradise under an umbrella, lying on a chaise lounge, with a drink in hand.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Tortola is one of the major islands within the chain of 50 known as the British Virgin Islands.  We’ll visit Road Town, the capital of the BVI, and then follow the road along the cliffs through colorful villages. A stop at one of the summits offers splendid views of the islands and its surroundings. We'll then travel to the southern coast to visit a vibrant craft and souvenir market.

This excursion cannot be combined with the excursion to the Baths on Virgin Gorda.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Excursion to the Baths on Virgin Gorda.

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Excursion to the Baths on Virgin Gorda.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Discover why Virgin Gorda is one of the top tourist destinations in the Caribbean. We’ll visit the most well-known attraction on the island, the giant boulders known as the Baths. You’ll have ample time to explore and swim in the natural tidal pools found within the arches, tunnels, and grottoes.  

We highly recommend wearing water shoes during your time at the Baths. Passengers who participate in this excursion must be in good physical condition.

This excursion cannot be combined with the Panoramic Tour of the Island excursion.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Discover the Rural Areas in the Dominican Republic.

Description.Title: Title
Description.Text: Discover the Rural Areas in the Dominican Republic.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
Although the Dominican Republic is known for its fantastic beaches, it also harbors many natural and cultural treasures. We’ll set out on a tour through the rural countryside to visit a sugar cane plantation and cigar factory. Afterwards, enjoy a stroll through the fishing village of Bayahibe and a tasting of some local treats, including fresh fruit, hot drinks, and the island’s famous, aromatic spirit, mamajuana.  

Because we use local, four-wheel-drive vehicles for this excursion, it is not recommended for pregnant women, passengers suffering from heart problems, or those with reduced mobility and people with back problems.

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Short description
Description.Text:

  • Times are approximate.

Description.Title: Long description
Description.Text:
The Samaná Peninsula is filled with palm forests, quiet beaches, and hidden caves. Each year, between January and March, it becomes the stage for an extraordinary ballet of migrating whales. If you have never experienced the magic of a whale watch from a small boat, this is the perfect opportunity to do so.

Although January and February are ideal times to whale watch, we cannot guarantee that you will see any during your excursion. 

PLEASE NOTE

  • The order of the visits can change.
  • Times are approximate.
